description: Adopt Bootstrap 5 for UI consistency across the Tea Alchemy web experience

userStories.title: Introduce Bootstrap 5 base styling
userStories.description: As a developer, I want Bootstrap 5 included so the UI has a consistent, production-ready foundation.
acceptanceCriteria: Bootstrap 5 CSS is loaded for all pages
Bootstrap 5 JS bundle is available where interactive components are used
Custom styles still load after Bootstrap
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Update homepage layout to Bootstrap
userStories.description: As a customer, I want a clean, responsive home page layout that looks consistent on mobile and desktop.
acceptanceCriteria: Homepage uses Bootstrap grid and spacing utilities
Product cards use Bootstrap card layout or a consistent card pattern
Typography and buttons use Bootstrap variants
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Update product detail page to Bootstrap
userStories.description: As a customer, I want the product detail layout to be clear and consistent with the rest of the site.
acceptanceCriteria: Product detail uses Bootstrap grid for layout
Add-to-cart and cart summary use Bootstrap buttons and cards
Spacing and headings use Bootstrap utilities
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Update custom blend flow pages to Bootstrap
userStories.description: As a customer, I want the custom blend steps to feel cohesive and easy to scan.
acceptanceCriteria: Each custom blend step page uses Bootstrap grid and cards
Step navigation uses Bootstrap buttons and alerts where appropriate
Forms (size/name) use Bootstrap form controls
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Update cart, checkout, and confirmation pages to Bootstrap
userStories.description: As a customer, I want cart and checkout flows to be consistent and easy to complete.
acceptanceCriteria: Cart, checkout, and confirmation use Bootstrap grid and cards
Form fields use Bootstrap input styling and validation states
Call-to-action buttons use Bootstrap variants
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Reduce custom CSS to brand overrides
userStories.description: As a developer, I want custom CSS to be minimal and focused on brand overrides so Bootstrap remains the primary system.
acceptanceCriteria: Custom CSS only handles brand colors, typography, and small layout tweaks
Legacy layout styles are removed or replaced by Bootstrap utilities
No visual regressions in core pages
Typecheck passes
